newsitem.title: USA: Dow ends lower after piercing 6,000; Nasdaq at new high.
newsitem.headline: Dow ends lower after piercing 6,000; Nasdaq at new high.

text.p: The Dow Jones industrial average ended lower Monday as it paused to catch its breath after poking through the 6,000-point level for the first time ever, while the Nasdaq market set a new high on the strength of technology stocks.

Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow closed 13.05 points lower at 5,979.81 following a brief run-up to 6,002.17. The Nasdaq ended up 3.23 at 1,250.79, beating its June 5 record finish of 1,249.15.
In the broader market, advancing issues led declines by a small margin on moderate volume of 383 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
